title: What happened when I ditched my smartphone for a tiny 'dumb phone'
text:
A common complaint for modern smartphones is that they are just too chunky. Take my own slate – a 6.1-inch palm-filler that I can barely claw my fingers across.

Phones have been getting bigger. After more than a decade on the market, the largest iPhone is now more than 6.4-inches. They have become so large now, that they we've stopped using laptops in favour of using our phones.

Which makes the return of Palm, a once defunct smartphone company that in 2009 was hailed by tech-lovers as a true challenger to the first iPhone models, all the more interesting.
